title: 110_hr333
content: The Act is titled the "Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act" and allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation concurrently. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act amends section 1414 of title 10, United States Code to include retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent. It also repeals the phase-in of concurrent receipt of retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act further amends section 1414 of title 10, United States Code by removing certain subsections and revising criteria for disability retirees with less than 20 years of service. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act amends section 1414 of title 10, United States Code by changing the retired pay for disability retirees with less than 20 years of service under chapter 61. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act amends section 1414 of title 10, United States Code to allow concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation for eligible members. Amendments include changes to the section heading and table of sections. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act allows concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation for eligible members. Amendments to section 1414 of title 10, United States Code include changes to the section heading and table of sections. Additionally, combat-related special compensation eligibility is extended to Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service. The amendment to section 1413a of title 10, United States Code, modifies eligibility for retired pay by removing certain criteria. Additionally, changes are made to the computation of payments for combat-related disabled uniformed services retirees with less than 20 years of service under chapter 61. The amendment modifies retired pay eligibility criteria and computation for combat-related disabled uniformed services retirees with less than 20 years of service under chapter 61. The amendments will take effect on the first day of the first month after the date of enactment. The amendment changes retired pay criteria for combat-related disabled uniformed services retirees with less than 20 years of service under chapter 61. Effective on the first day of the first month after enactment, it will apply to payments for months after that date.
